intro: Lithocardium parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered lithocardium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Lithocardium parviflorum is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
